helics-opt Documentation¶

This software package was created as part of a master’s thesis at the Institute of Aircraft Design and Lightweight Structures at the Technical University of Braunschweig. It offers an automated design and optimization routine for anisotropic UAV propellers.

UML Sequence Diagram of the Workflow in helics-opt.¶

Requirements¶

Operating System¶

  • The pyansys library works best on Linux. The interface to ANSYS is a bit buggy on Windows systems.

  • This software package was created under CentOS 7.

Software¶

  • ANSYS MAPDL. This Software package was created using Ansys 2019 R1.

  • Xfoil for the calculation of profile polars. (CentOS Package)

  • Xrotor for the calculationn of propeller loads. (CentOS Package)

  • Xvfb (X Virtual Frame Buffer), if you want to hide the Xfoil and Xrotor processes. (CentOS Package)

Pyhon librarys¶

  • pyansys provides the python interface to ANSYS MAPDL.

  • pyOpt provides the optimizer. (GitHub)

  • Numpy

  • Pandas

  • Matplotlib
